title: Integers comparison proposed fix is not the best one

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=d1da64277f7c213e013bf8d262aaf13f

```rust
fn main() {
    let a : u32 = 1;
    let b: usize = 2;
    if a > b {
        println!("Hello, world!");
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:12
  |
4 |     if a > b {
  |            ^ expected `u32`, found `usize`
  |
help: you can convert a `usize` to a `u32` and panic if the converted value doesn't fit
  |
4 |     if a > b.try_into().unwrap() {
  |             ++++++++++++++++++++

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:12
  |
4 |     if a > b {
  |            ^ expected `u32`, found `usize`
  |
help: you can convert a `u32` to a `usize` without panic
  |
4 |     if a as usize > b {
  |             ++++++++++++++++++++

```

I expect a comparison between 2 integers of different types to use the largest type to get the right result

cf https://github.com/OISF/suricata/commit/6f03ee2e47d331aa29524d81777c970415b817f1
This kind of unsigned integer overflow led later to a buffer overflow such as `thread '<unnamed>' panicked at 'range start index 16 out of
range for slice of length 14', src/dcerpc/dcerpc.rs:1074:56`
